Content.Text: <NAME_UNKOWN>Hey, you there! Are you <MYNAME>?

<FACE_NEEL><POS_RIGHT><FACE_NORMAL>
<NAME_UNKOWN>I'm <BLUE>Neil</BLUE>. I run the
<GREEN>Animal Store</GREEN> in this town.
<PAGE>
<FACE_NEEL><POS_RIGHT><FACE_NORMAL>Old man Dunhill sends me to give his
regards.

<FACE_NEEL><POS_RIGHT><FACE_NORMAL>
Oh, this? Think of it as a 
contribution to your stock.

<FACE_NEEL><POS_RIGHT><FACE_NORMAL>
Don't get me wrong! It's a present from
Dunhill. I'm just the messenger.

<FACE_NEEL><POS_RIGHT><FACE_NORMAL>
How about picking a name?

<FACE_NEEL><POS_RIGHT><FACE_NORMAL>
Hmph. I guess that will do.

<FACE_NEEL><POS_RIGHT><FACE_NORMAL>
This one doesn't normally trust people.
I had a hard time bringing her here.
I think she's quite fond of you.

<FACE_NEEL><POS_RIGHT><FACE_NORMAL>
What can I do? It was her farewell gift.
I'll give it to you as a present, but
just this one time.

<FACE_NEEL><POS_RIGHT><FACE_NORMAL>
Well, aren't you loaded with stuff? You
gotta have at least <RED>three slots 
available</RED>, or else...

<FACE_NEEL><POS_RIGHT><FACE_NORMAL>
There's not enough space in your bag.
Make sure to have at least <RED>three slots
available</RED>.

<FACE_NEEL><POS_RIGHT><FACE_NORMAL>
Here's a <GREEN>milker</GREEN>, a <GREEN>brush</GREEN> and a
<GREEN>pitchfork</GREEN>. Use them wisely!

<FACE_NEEL><POS_RIGHT><FACE_NORMAL>
Wait a minute! Aren't you a total
beginner at stock breeding? Do you even
know how to take care of animals?
Nope.
Of course I do!

<FACE_NEEL><POS_RIGHT><FACE_NORMAL>
Just as I thought! Well, well. I'll have
to give you a crash course.

<FACE_NEEL><POS_RIGHT><FACE_NORMAL>
This is the <BLUE>barn</BLUE>. You keep all your
livestock in here. By the way, the hens
stay in the coop.

<FACE_NEEL><POS_RIGHT><FACE_NORMAL>
I'm going in. Follow me.

<FACE_NEEL><POS_RIGHT><FACE_NORMAL>
This is the <BLUE>barn</BLUE>. You keep all your
livestock in here. By the way, the hens
stay in the coop.

<FACE_NEEL><POS_RIGHT><FACE_NORMAL>
In that case, you're good to go! If you
have any doubts, take a look at the
<BLUE>bookshelf</BLUE> in your house.
<PAGE>
So, should I tell you more about my
<GREEN>Animal Store</GREEN>? 
<PAGE>
It's open <BLUE>from Monday to Thursday</BLUE>, and
the hours are from <BLUE>10:00 AM to 6:00 PM</BLUE>.
<PAGE>
We're closed on <BLUE>Friday, Saturday and 
Sunday</BLUE>, so make sure to buy everything 
you need beforehand.

<FACE_NEEL><POS_RIGHT><FACE_NORMAL>
Also, my shop is located on the <GREEN>Town 
Plaza</GREEN>, so it's closed on rainy days.
Keep that in mind!

<FACE_NEEL><POS_RIGHT><FACE_NORMAL>
So, I'll be heading back. <MOJI0> is
counting　on you, so make sure you take
proper care of her.

<FACE_NEEL><POS_RIGHT><FACE_NORMAL>
To take care of your animals, you need:
<RED>physical contact, brushing, harvesting,
feed, a clean barn, and grazing</RED>.
<PAGE>
I'll explain them one by one. Pay 
attention!

First, <RED>physical contact</RED>.
Talk to your animals and pet them.
You don't need any special tools,
so make sure to do it every day.

Animals get dirty easily, so use a
<RED>brush</RED> on them. Equip
your brush, and press the <BLUE>A Button</BLUE>.

Next, you need to <RED>harvest any animal
products</RED>: <GREEN>Milk</GREEN> from cows and <GREEN>wool</GREEN>
from sheep. Hens will lay <GREEN>eggs</GREEN>. 
Use the <GREEN>milker</GREEN> to get milk, and
<GREEN>clippers</GREEN> to get wool. Equip one
and press the <BLUE>A Button</BLUE>.

Eggs can be easily picked up. You will
find them <RED>only in the nesting boxes</RED>.

Next up is <RED>feeding</RED>. Give <GREEN>fodder</GREEN> to
livestock and <GREEN>chicken feed</GREEN> to poultry.

I sell both fodder and chicken feed
in my store. Since we aren't open
every day, you should stock up.


<PAGE>
Keep the feed in your <BLUE>storage</BLUE>. Use it
freely with the <BLUE>A Button</BLUE>.

To feed the animals, take the fodder
from storage and put it in the 
<BLUE>feed box</BLUE>. One unit is enough for
<RED>five servings</RED>. Make sure there's
enough for all your animals.

Next we'll cover how to <RED>clean the
barn</RED>. When the Barn gets <GREEN>dirty</GREEN>,
you should use the <GREEN>pitchfork</GREEN>.
Equip it and press the <BLUE>A Button</BLUE> to
get rid of the dirt.

Make sure to do this often to keep
your barn clean.

<FACE_NEEL><POS_RIGHT><FACE_NORMAL>
The final step is <RED>grazing</RED>. Let the
animals out on sunny or snowy days. 
Return them to the barn in the evening.
<PAGE>
Letting them out on rainy or windy days
causes a great deal of stress, so don't
make that mistake!

<FACE_NEEL><POS_RIGHT><FACE_NORMAL>
To let the animals out, push them out  
of the barn. Repeat the process to
bring them back inside.
<PAGE>
Get ready for a lot of hard work. Using
the <GREEN>farm bell</GREEN> can make your work a bit
easier.

<FACE_NEEL><POS_RIGHT><FACE_NORMAL>
Whoa, I almost forgot! I have to tell
you about <BLUE>animal information</BLUE> as
well.

<FACE_NEEL><POS_LEFT><FACE_NORMAL>
Here is the <BLUE>animal information</BLUE>.

<FACE_NEEL><POS_LEFT><FACE_NORMAL>
Use this to keep track of the animals'
<RED>mood levels</RED>, <RED>stress levels</RED> and 
<RED>daily care status</RED>. Check it out.

The hearts next to the animal's name 
indicate its mood level.

Their mood level goes up when you take
care of them. The quality of their
side products rises with their mood.

Give them lots of affection!

The animals' <RED>stress level</RED> is displayed
by the blue bar. Take care of them
properly so it won't rise.


High levels of stress makes the animal
more vulnerable to <RED>diseases</RED>, so be
careful.

<FACE_NEEL><POS_LEFT><FACE_NORMAL>
Sick animals are not productive. 

<PAGE>
I sell <GREEN>animal medicine</GREEN> in my store. Use
it to treat them.
<PAGE>
If you leave them to fend for themselves
they'll die. Be sure to use the
medicine!

<FACE_NEEL><POS_LEFT><FACE_NORMAL>
So, that's pretty much it. You can
always check back in your <BLUE>bookshelf</BLUE>.

<FACE_NEEL><POS_LEFT><FACE_NORMAL>
Finally, let me tell you about my
<GREEN>Animal Store</GREEN>.
<PAGE>
It's open <BLUE>from Monday to Thursday</BLUE>, and
the hours are from <BLUE>10:00 AM to 6:00 PM</BLUE>.
<PAGE>
We're closed on <BLUE>Friday, Saturday and 
Sunday</BLUE>, so make sure to buy everything 
you need beforehand.

<FACE_NEEL><POS_LEFT><FACE_NORMAL>
Also, my shop is located in the <GREEN>Town 
Plaza</GREEN>, so it's closed on rainy days.
Keep that in mind!

<FACE_NEEL><POS_LEFT><FACE_NORMAL>
So, I'll be heading back. <MOJI0> is
counting　on you, so make sure you take
proper care of her.

<FACE_NEEL><POS_RIGHT><FACE_NORMAL>
Oh, your bag seems to be full. Okay,
I'll send everything to the <BLUE>toolbox</BLUE>
labeled "<MYNAME>" in your house.

<SPEED_IMME>
Received <GREEN>Tools for breeding animals</GREEN>!

Received <GREEN>Tools for breeding animals</GREEN>!
Check out the <BLUE>toolbox</BLUE> later.

<SPEED_IMME>
Received a <BLUE>Cow</BLUE>!

<FACE_NEEL><POS_RIGHT><FACE_NORMAL>
How about <BLUE><MOJI0></BLUE>?
This sounds right.
Think of something else.

<FACE_NEEL><POS_RIGHT><FACE_NORMAL>
What are you doing? Just give her a
name already!

<FACE_NEEL><POS_LEFT><FACE_NORMAL>
What are you doing? Just give her a
name already!
